metadata.Title: CVE-2015-8983 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Integer overflow in the _IO_wstr_overflow function in libio/wstrops.c in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) before 2.22 allows context-dependent attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code via vectors related to computing a size in bytes, which triggers a heap-based buffer overflow. It was discovered that an integer overflow existed in the _IO_wstr_overflow() function of the GNU C Library. An attacker could use this to cause a denial of service or possibly execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-8983` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

glibc-source - 2.23-0ubuntu3
libc-bin - 2.23-0ubuntu3
libc6 - 2.23-0ubuntu3
libc6-amd64 - 2.23-0ubuntu3
libc6-armel - 2.23-0ubuntu3
libc6-i386 - 2.23-0ubuntu3
libc6-pic - 2.23-0ubuntu3
libc6-ppc64 - 2.23-0ubuntu3
libc6-s390 - 2.23-0ubuntu3
libc6-x32 - 2.23-0ubuntu3
locales - 2.23-0ubuntu3
locales-all - 2.23-0ubuntu3
multiarch-support - 2.23-0ubuntu3
nscd - 2.23-0ubuntu3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: glibc package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.23-0ubuntu3').
